sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>mouth</radical> of a <radical>tree</radical> <radical>leader</radical> is all about trying to <kanji>preserve</kanji> the trees. In fact, she <kanji>guarantee</kanji>s that she will preserve the trees if it's the last thing she does.
meaningInfo: Basically, a tree leader is someone who stands up for trees. Mostly she talks, but that can be a powerful skill to have.
readingMnemonic: She chains herself to a tree to <kanji>preserve</kanji> them. But, unfortunately, the lumberjacks just take a giant back <reading>ho</reading>e (<ja>ほ</ja>) and tear this tree leader and the tree she's attached to in half.
readingInfo: What a terrible scene. Focus on the fact that they're using a horrible, modified back hoe. It's more like a weapon than a back hoe, and they show no mercy at all.
